title: Is it possible to study the IB curriculum on my own and just sit for the exam, or do I have to attend classes? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m a bit confused by the question, but I’ll answer it the best I can. If this question is asking, “Can I skip my IB classes (just not attend them) or not pay attention in them and learn the material on my own?” Partially, but even at you’re best, you most likely will not do well. IB requires 6 classes (3 HL/3 SL or 4 HL/2 SL), in addition to TOK. HL courses are meant to be taught over a two year span (sometimes 1.5 years). That is a lot of material to cover on one’s own, especially if studying an HL Group 4 Subject like Chemistry or Physics. Additionally, TOK is most likely not going to make much sense on one’s own. Also, IB Subjects requires students to write IAs, which teachers need to grade. You aren’t getting around that one. Each Subject requires one. TOK requires the TOK essays. Then, we haven’t even discussed the Extended Essay or CAS…  If this question is asking, “Can I just take IB exams without taking the class?” Nope. Only AP exams are like that. Those things I mentioned before; IAs, Extended Essays, CAS… If you don’t turn in an IA, you fail the subject automatically, regardless of how well you do on the exam. You fail you EE? You aren’t getting the Diploma. Don’t finish CAS? No Diploma for you.  There is no easy way to do IB on your own without failing in some way, whether not knowing the material well enough or not completing the extra requirements. If you want courses that you can just sit for the exam, do AP.  A2A

Technically speaking you are supposed to attend a specific amount of hours of class time for both SL and HL subjects. However I have never read that attendance is mandatory. I have never met a student who could do SL or HL chemistry without guidance. I am sure I have had a few that could have been given materials, met with me periodically and done well, but that is an exceptional student and circumstances would have to be just right to allow that to happen. I have had students who have the intro material down cold and are itching to go faster, only to beg me for more time when we get to Organic or learning IR and NMR spectra. You would need to arrange this with your teachers and school and you will appreciate the monitoring and meetings if they even allow it. Good Luck.
